intro: Schleichera pentapetala, commonly known as the five-petaled schleichera, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, light gray bark and broad, palmately lobed leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length. The tree produces small, fragrant yellow flowers in clusters, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
